intro: Boehmeria platyphylla var. masoalensis, commonly known as the Madagascar nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Urticaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
